contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary}} {{wikiquote}} '''Hometown''' or '''home town''' is the city or town where one grew up, or the place of one's principal residence. It is not to be confused with birthplace, although the two can be the same place. '''Hometown''' may also refer to: ==Places== *[[Hometown, Illinois]] *[[Hometown, Pennsylvania]] *[[Hometown, West Virginia]] ==Other uses== * [[Ancestral home (Chinese)]], the place of origin of one's extended family * [[Hometown Band]], a band active in the 1970s * HomeTown Buffet, a restaurant chain of [[Buffets, Inc.]] * ''[[Hometown High-Q]]'', a high school quiz bowl game show on television * "Hometown", a song by French duo [[Miss Kittin]] & The Hacker * "Hometown", a song by British singer [[Andy Burrows]], featured in his 2012 album "Company" * "[[My Hometown]]", a song by Bruce Springsteen * [[Hometown (TV Series)|''Hometown'' (TV Series)]], a short-lived 1985 dramedy on CBS, adapted from the hit movie ''The Big Chill'' * [[Hometown (album)|''Hometown'' (album)]], the third studio album by Canadian Rock band Ten Second Epic * [[Hometown (film)|''Hometown'' (film)]], a 1983 Japanese film * ''Home Town'', a nonfiction 1999 account of life in [[Northampton, Massachusetts]] by [[Tracy Kidder]] {{Disambig}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2010}} [[Category:Place name disambiguation pages]]
